text: hello I'm David Pogue I'm on the road
this week I'm actually speaking in Iowa
this week to stay with the fewest
consonants of any in the nation except
maybe Ohio Des Moines anyway I thought
I'd give you a closer look at the
subject of my times review this week
it's this the palm centro from sprint
basically it's a trio that is it's got a
cell phone complete with speakerphone
and Bluetooth a built in 1.3 megapixel
camera for nice clear stills or videos a
memory card slot a ringer off switch
hallelujah and a really really tiny
thumb keyboard and it's all driven by
the aging but still excellent palm
operating system complete with tiny
little menus and a touch screen you can
use either the stylus or your fingers so
why did they call it the Centro and not
you know the trio 900 or something two
reasons really one is it's smaller two
tenths of an inch smaller in height
width and depth than the existing trio
may not seem like much but in your hand
it really feels like a lot and also it's
cheaper it's ninety nine dollars when
all is said and done in the rebates and
the two-year sprint contract or spoken
for a hundred bucks that's the cheapest
keyboard and smartphone in history
Sprint's internet service starts at
fifteen dollars a month on top of your
voice plan and it gets you all the bells
and whistles at a pretty decent rate of
speed web browsing email of course there
are built in chat programs and for when
you're really bored even sprint TV plus
you can install thousands of free or
cheap palm OS add-on programs like
google maps it's not as slick here as it
is on the iphone but it's nice to have
anyway
there's also a sprint optional program
on this thing that really blew my mind
called nuanced voice control see the
little button right here on the side I'm
going to hold that in and I'm going to
give a command let's pretend I'm driving
okay appointment night out with Jennifer
date tomorrow time 745pm now I let go
with a button I wait about half second
okay and then check this out it opens up
my calendar and there it is a perfect
time perfectly transcribed or how about
this I'm walking along I decide I need
to send an email I hold in the button I
say email brian gallagher subject sorry
about my column body I promise it won't
happen next time comma my friend period
please forgive me period David okay I
wait just a minute for processing okay
and there it is check it out all filled
in and ready to mail unfortunately they
want seven dollars a month for this
which is way too much but you know nice
job on the technology part so you know
what the sentra really is nothing more
than a repackaged trio it's a much
smaller case and a much lower price it's
aimed at young people and people who've
never had an alphabet keyboard on their
cell phones before but you know what
even though those changes are just
superficial they make all the difference
in the world sometimes it's what's
outside that counts David Pope the New
York Times
